item.title: .NET Threading and WebAssembly
item.description:
Threading, in general operating systems sense, is not something that the web has been able to use until very recently. The addition of Threads support in WebAssembly, and the activation of the threading support in Chrome opens up a whole new world of possibilities, including the use of Reactive Extensions (Rx.NET) or the Task Parallel Library (TPL).
Let’s dive in, with some sample code.
item.author: (https://jaylee.org/about/)

item.title: Detroit: Become Human - Scan effect in Unity
item.description:
In Detroit: Become Human, in the role of the androids we could perform a scan of the environment. Today we re-create this effect on Unity.
GITHUB: https://github.com/ToughNutToCrack/DetroitScanEffect
ITACHANNEL: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtj_LuYF9i5xkk4Q9EYamYA
INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/tntcproject/
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/tntcproject
WEBSITE: https://toughnuttocrack.it/
#unity3d #tutorial #Detroit

item.title: Building a Custom Router for Blazor
item.description: In this post, I'm going to show you how you can build your own convention based router component to replace the default router that ships with Blazor.

item.title: How a 2 person startup already uses 28 other tools
item.description: At Across, we wanted to see how many other technology companies and service providers we use on a regular basis. The answer was way more than we thought. For a seed stage 2 person startup, we already use 28 different tools regularly totaling $227 / month (we’re on the free plans

item.title: A half-hour to learn Rust
item.description: In order to increase fluency in a programming language, one has to read a lot of it. But how can you read a lot of it if you don't know what it means? In this article, instead of focusing on one or two concepts, I'll try to go through as many Rust snippets as I can, and explain what the keywords and symbols they contain mean. Ready? Go! let introduces a variable binding:
